movies.title: Tornarem
movies.plot: Fleeing Franco's troops enter Barcelona at the end of the Civil War Felip and Lola are in despair as his daughter Mary is abducted by the Phalangists. Forced to go into exile, the marriage will be held in the concentration camp Argelers. When they get out, Felip return to Barcelona to try to get his daughter, even though the events bring him to Africa, where she will fight for five years under General Leclerc. Meanwhile, in France, Lola meet Manel, a pin of refugees, who can not help falling in love ...
movies.simplePlot: Fleeing Franco's troops enter Barcelona at the end of the Civil War Felip and Lola are in despair as his daughter Mary is abducted by the Phalangists. Forced to go into exile, the marriage ...

biography.bio: Background and Studies Born in Frankfurt/Main (Germany), raised in Bommersheim. A Levels Graduation at the Lansdowne College, London, England. Moved to Spain. Introduction to the Actors' Training at Studio Teatro in Barcelona by Boris Rotenstein. Moved to New York. Fulltime Studies at the Lee Strasberg Theatre Institute New York. moved to Berlin. Work in Theatre, Television and Film Projects. Workshops with Mike Figgis in Cologne and Master Class / European Film Academy (EFA) in Ljubljana, Slovenia. Summer Intensive at the Herbert Berghof Studio in New York. Continuous Training of the Meisner Technique with Mike Bernardin (Actors Space Berlin). And Workshops with Peter Kyle (Dance), Wolfgang Wimmer, Scott Williams and Bill Esper. Speaks and works fluently in English, Spanish and German.
biography.name: Fabian Passamonte

biography.bio: Born in Paris, France - Jean Claude is a true international actor, fluent in French, Spanish and English as well as a sophisticated world traveler who spent his adolescence between the tropical beaches of Tahiti and the hustle and bustle of London where he perfected his English. Having traveled the world from Europe to Africa and America, he now resides in Barcelona, Spain. While in Italy in 2007, Jean Claude re.discovered his passion for acting at the Carnival of Venice as he captivated an audience of thousands with his timeless impersonation of "Casanova." Upon returning to Spain he was cast in several international commercials including Mitsubishi and Burger King as well as appeared in over 30 short films including the winning Cinema Vip - Sony Film "Una Ventana Al Futuro". Jean Claude worked consistently through the following years acting in many independent Spanish films including Embrión (2008), Catalunya über alles! (2011) , Red Lights (2012) and a TV Mini-Serie Tornarem (2012). 2015 was a great year for Jean Claude. First he is cast to play with Miryam Gallego and the multiple award-winning actress Carmen Maura in the famous TV series Águila Roja (2009) (Red Eagle) as a XVII Th century justice officer. Then he played a WWI French captain along side Jean Reno in The Promise (2016), starring Christian Bale and directed by Terry George. In 2016 he wrote and act in a short movie comedy Mon ami, ma femme et une morue (2016) his opera prima as a director.
biography.name: Jean Claude Ricquebourg

biography.bio: Oscar Foronda, one of Catalunya's renowned faces in television and film, who started his career as an actor quite late in life. Being a student of Philosophy at the age of 25 he realized his dedication goes out to theatre play and music. He was born Oscar Luis Manuel Pallares Foronda on September 13, 1970, in Barcelona, Catalonia, Spain, as the younger of four brothers. As a young child, Foronda regularly was taken to the movie theaters by his father, along with his three older brothers. Quite early in life he developed a passion for film and theatre after seeing the movie "2001: A Space Odyssey" at the age of 12. Foronda was a sportive youngster and with 16 the Spanish karate kid winning first titles in martial arts in the State of Catalonia. He defeats the bullies, wins the attention of the audiences and becomes a respected and professional body-builder. Foronda competes successfully until the age of 23, albeit his sports career ends when he starts theater playing. Foronda began his acting right into the field and taking some courses while working in all kind of jobs in Spain and made his acting debut at a small theatre company called Cercle d'Or. With this small theatre he gave performances in small town theaters and on the street. IN 1999 he started working as an actor for the Theatre Del Liceu in Barcelona and afterwards also in Teatro Real in Madrid, becoming one of the most wanted members of both Theatres. Many famous Theatre directors were in great demand for staging Operas in need of specific actor roles. Foronda had the privilege of working with singers such as Jose Carreras, Montserrat Caballe, Placido Domingo, Natalie Dessai, Edita Gruverova. He also worked abroad, in theater Bolshoi of Moscow along with Sir Williard White. Foronda's stage performances caught the attention of film director Tono Errando, who cast the actor in his film debut La Gran mentira del rock'n'roll (2002). It was Forondas first role in a movie. The same year Foronda played the character of Macduff in Macbeth as theatre play, directed by Calixto Bieito. The performances lasted 1 ½ years and ended up in the famed theatre of Barbican in London, former location of the Royal Shakespeare Company. In 2003 Foronda made his debut in a first TV series "El Comisario". He played a lover who ended up being eradicated by his girlfriend. After these TV series Foronda frequently stared in many renowned Spanish and foreign TV series, such as Hospital Central, Porca misèria, or Hispania. One of his first English speaking roles was in 2010 in the British TV series "Any Human Heart", directed by Michael Samuels. Foronda plays a Lieutenant. Foronda established himself as a nationally known Latin heartthrob with charming expressions. Outside of his acting profession, Foronda has been a passionate music fan and a loyal supporter of the FC Barcelona Football Club.
biography.name: Oscar Foronda
